experiment: F-HLP4: Task recognizer routing accuracy benchmark
hypothesis: task_recognizer.py achieves >50% top-1 accuracy on real swarm tasks

methodology.data_source: 40 real session tasks extracted from tasks/NEXT.md session notes S351-S358
methodology.ground_truth: Actual domain worked in each session (from lane IDs and dispatch notes)

failure_modes: nk-complexity misrouted to expert-swarm (x2): NK tasks use K_avg/hub/Gini not in seeds
meta misrouted to evolution (x2): 'harvest'/'generation' trigger evolution seeds
meta misrouted to ai (x2): 'agent'/'coordination' trigger ai seeds
meta misrouted to governance (x2): 'audit'/'compliance' trigger governance seeds
information-science misrouted to evolution (x2): 'harvest'/'experiments' trigger evolution
root_causes: Confidence saturated: min(1.0, raw/sqrt(query_size)) caps at 1.0 for any task >8 tokens
Swarm vocabulary false cognates: harvest/frontier/dispatch/claim mean different things per domain
Domain seeds are textbook definitions, not operational vocabulary
F-ID prefixes (F-SP1, F-NK) contain domain signal but are ignored by recognizer
Meta domain has largest keyword set — attracts AND repels simultaneously

conclusion: 35% top-1 accuracy is insufficient for automated routing. The recognizer works as a seed — it was built at S188 and never updated with operational vocabulary. Four fixes identified: operational seeds, F-ID boosting, relative confidence, swarm-term deprioritization. Hypothesis falsified (50% target not met).
